newsitem.title: MOROCCO: German bank increases holding in Moroccan bank.
newsitem.headline: German bank increases holding in Moroccan bank.

text.p: German Commerzbank has increased its holding to 10 percent from 1.6 percent in the capital of Morocco's Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur, said BMCE in a statement on Monday.
"The operation of the CommerzBank can be considered as a strategic investment which underlines the German institution's confidence in the future of the privatised BMCE," said the statement.
The BMCE's capital stands at 1.44 billion dirhams divided into 14.4 million shares of 100 dirhams nominal value.
Some 10,529 BMCE shares changed hands on the official market on Monday when the share was up 10 dirhams to 500 dirhams, a Casablanca-based stockbroker said.
